issue.body:
This pull request is a result of the issue #1303 and PR #1083
Check _y and cutoff is None after construction for univariate, both and multivariate y

issue.title: Fix test sktimeforecasters for univariate, both and multivariate y

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

body:
Note: these are checks that fail if the forecaster is multivariate, but does *not* accept univariate input.

This is a strange edge case that can be found for instance in `statsmodels` VAR, which doesn't take one-column data frames.

The gist is that the tests need to replace all test cases which currently use univariate series with bi- or higher variate ones.

Multivariate models that are fine with taking univariate series do not fail the tests, e.g., the `ColumnForecaster` that @GuzalBulatova implemented.

rename.from: [BUG] Tests and checks failing for Multivariate Forecasters
rename.to: [BUG] Tests and checks failing for Multivariate Forecasters that cannot take univariate series

issue.title: Check predicted index in update_predict for univariate, both and multivariate y

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

body:
To summarize the "end point" logic we agreed on in our meeting today, @thayeylolu:

* if the forecaster is "univariate" (in the `scitype:y` tag), the current test logic should be run
* if the forecaster is "multivariate", generation of univariate examples should be replaced by bivariate examples, and any related logic adapted
* if the forecaster is "both", *both* of the above should be tested, i.e., running current tests with univariate examples, and then *also* (as in: in addition) running the tests with bivariate examples

an exception are cases where the thing that is being tested is plausibly unrelated to the form of `y`, for instance:

* `test_get_fitted_params`
* test_X_invalid_type_raises_error`

issue.title: Tests failing for VAR in test_all_forecasters.py now  accommodates multivariate and both estimators

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body: The changes made to the `test_all_forecasters.py` was to ensure VAR model pass all test in it. It also ensures that estimators that handles univariate and multivariate forecasters pass. Please seee #1303

body: This was fixed with the linked PR and the multivariate upgrade in 0.8.0.
